summary: This document is a chain of emails from July to September 2021 between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), the FBI New York Field Office, and the NYPD. The emails discuss outreach to and communication with a person identified as Ghislaine Maxwell's former assistant, who has offered to provide information to aid in Maxwell's prosecution. The correspondence includes planning for an interview and references an FBI 302 report being prepared.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the prosecution. Her former assistant is offering information to help the case against her.

events.title: Assistant's Initial Contact
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's former assistant sends an initial email to the U.S. Attorney's Office offering information to help the prosecution.

events.title: Agent Connects with Assistant
events.description: An FBI Special Agent reports having connected with Maxwell's former assistant and plans to speak with her the following night.

events.title: Interview Notes and 302 Report
events.description: An FBI agent confirms having spoken with the assistant, will send notes and emails, and states the FBI 302 report is written and awaiting serialization.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's former assistant proactively contacted prosecutors in July 2021, offering information to aid in Maxwell's prosecution.
The assistant reportedly lived with the email sender while working for Maxwell, suggesting a close personal connection.
FBI and NYPD officials coordinated outreach to this potential witness over a two-month period in 2021.
An FBI 302 report (formal interview summary) based on the assistant's information was written and awaiting processing as of September 22, 2021.
The email chain shows active investigation and witness coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office, FBI, and NYPD post-Maxwell's arrest.
